posts.name: Mohammed
posts.cooked: Hello, We are currently facing a problem where the swerve wheels go inward/outwards during steering doing like an X pattern (just like the picture shown), the driving works perfectly fine, we are using Advantage Kit 2025 with the constants being generated with the Phoenix Tuner X generator and our swerve modules are mk4n, Whats the solution for this problem?

posts.name: Val
posts.cooked: Question, are both of these diagrams based on advantage scope or is the current position based off of looking at the chassis? I want to clarify that this isn’t a thing with how data is being displayed and is a code error Advantage scope let’s you change the order of the modules (is FL the first item in the array or is it FR type of thing) If driving is working fine then it might be that the way the desired positions are displayed and the current positions are displayed are different.

posts.name: Mohammed
posts.cooked: On advantage scope it shows the wheels being perfectly fine and working like how they are intended to be, but by looking at it physically it does an X shape, also FL is the first item in the array

posts.name: Val
posts.cooked: Make sure the arrays are exactly the same for both, assuming they are this is an interesting issue. Here is a couple of clarifying questions: (that’ll hopefully help narrow down what’s up with it) Does this issue persist when in other orientations? Is it defaulting to the X position when not moving or is there some sort of offset that’s happening? Can you clarify what you mean by “driving is working fine”? Is the chassis going the expected direction or is the chassis going at a weird angle? Are the modules reacting as expected (ie they look like they have reached their setpoints? Or are they vibrating around some point or moving? (If the error persists when changing the angle of the module then what is the behavior while the module is rotating?)

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked:
More than likely your CAN IDs do not physically match the correct corners of the robot.

Make sure the IDs for the front left of the bot are indeed matching the physical front left corner of the bot, and so on for the other corners

posts.name: Mohammed
posts.cooked:
Yes the X position does persist in every orientation (except when we try moving while steering of course)

by “driving is working fine” I mean that the left joystick (driving x,y) makes the robot move straight (forward, backward, left, right), however when steering it does the X shape, also forgot to mention that when we press the X button, it makes the wheels how they should be while steering ( the X button should initially make the wheels go into an X shape in a working robot )

posts.name: Mohammed
posts.cooked: I have verified the cancoders are indeed correct for each module

posts.name: Val
posts.cooked:
Mohammed:

when we press the X button, it makes the wheels how they should be while steering ( the X button should initially make the wheels go into an X shape in a working robot )

That’s interesting! Does the X shape behavior you’re trying to fix go away when you comment out this trigger? Also could you share the code for the robot? (If you aren’t able to sharing the code that binds the command to the button would also be useful) My current best guess for what’s happening is that something is running the X shape command when it shouldn’t?

posts.name: Val
Mohammed
posts.cooked: but that function is only called when the X button is pressed, its made for the robot to stop it immediately, i don’t think it interferes with the issue

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked: Not the cancoders… The motor controllers

posts.name: Mohammed
posts.cooked: What do you mean by motor controllers?

posts.name: Mohammed
posts.cooked: @jonahb55 This has made me go crazy, A help with this would be appreciated

image 1046×420 25 KB

image 1046×420 25 KB

image 1046×420 25 KB

posts.name: Mohammed
posts.cooked: Thanks for the visualization it narrows the problem down, but why is it that the robot like rotated 90 degrees? I have made sure multiple times of the locations and IDs of each module is correct and still face the issue, is it something that has to do with the mk4n module?

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: If the only thing you changed in the project is the TunerConstants file, that suggests that there was a problem when configuring the drive in Tuner X. Can you repeat that setup process using the swerve project generator and confirm that you pass all of the verification steps in Tuner X? If you still have issues, you may want to try following the manual setup instructions in the documentation . In particular, check that TurnPosition and TurnAbsolutePosition follow the orientation described in the documentation after calibration.

posts.name: Benjamin Hall
posts.cooked: Did you make sure during the steer test that the modules spun counter-clockwise as seen from the top of the robot (as is stated in bold cyan letters)? Looking at your TunerConstants, those steer inverts look wrong, I would expect the motors to be inverted and the encoders not to be.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics

posts.custom_user_title: Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics

posts.name: Mohammed
posts.cooked: Thank you so much this fixed the problem, we did this multiple times and made sure of everything but having another try made it work i guess

posts.name: Mohammed
posts.cooked: You are correct the problem was indeed from the TunerConstants file, we didn’t properly invert the steering wheels, Thank you so much!
